form.name: form1

div.span: WCSD buildings are closed March 16 - May 1

span.p: In accordance with Governor DeWine's directive all face-to-face classes and events are canceled through May 1st.

div.span:
The Family Resource Center of Wickliffe Information
Hours for the week of April 20:
Monday, 4/20: Open, 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM
Tuesday, 4/21: Closed
Wednesday, 4/22: Open, 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM
Thursday, 4/23: Closed
Friday, 4/24: Open, 10:00 AM - 1:00 PM

div.div:
2221 Rockefeller Road Wickliffe, Ohio 44092
Phone: 440.943.6900 | Fax: 440.943.7738

span.div:
Wickliffe Schools Community,
1. The Family Resource Center will be open the week of April 20, 2020 on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday for distribution of meals, food, supplies, and educational materials from 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.
2. For students who completed schoolwork via paper/pencil, the work may be turned into the Family Resource Center during its regular hours. Please make sure to label the work with your name, the subject, and the teacher and the Family Resource Center staff will get it to the correct people.
3. To all students, please make sure to follow directions of your teachers and complete work as assigned. Please remember, all grading is based on Pass/Not Complete, so the completion of work is important for purposes of evaluation.
4. Students, please remember to read, enjoy hobbies, and get some physical activity every day.
5. Most importantly, please take care of yourselves, follow the recommendations of health professionals, and stay healthy.
Please take time to talk to your kids about the dangers of the internet. This video is courtesy of the Ohio Attorney General. Internet Safety Video

h3.span: Wickliffe Community Survey - New Building Exterior Visual Preference

span.div: Then Design Architecture is interested in gathering your feedback on aesthetic elements for the exterior of the new PK-12 school building for Wickliffe City School District.
Please complete the survey by Tuesday, April 21st: Visual Preference Survey

div.span:
Wickliffe Families,
Below are updates for the week of April 13, 2020.
1. This week, the Family Resource Center is open 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday for the distribution of meals, hygiene products and supplies, and educational materials, including electronic devices.
2. Students, please remember to communicate with your teachers daily and complete learning activities and opportunities throughout the week. Also, take time daily to read, be physically active, practice and participate in your hobbies, and have some fun.
3. As a reminder to all athletes, eligibility for fall sports is based on fourth quarter grades. To be eligible, students must pass the equivalent of five one-credit classes for high school eligibility and the passing of five classes during the fourth quarter for students in grades 7 and 8. Please complete work as required by your teachers to ensure your eligibility in the fall. Remember, all grading this quarter is based on a Pass/Incomplete, so please ensure you pass all classes.
4. If any student or family needs technology assistance for the completion of schoolwork, please email Mr. Jim Barno @ [email protected] and Mr. Barno will someone from the IT department will respond.
5. To all Wickliffe Families, please check the website this week and complete the Exterior Preference Survey that Then Design Architecture has built and is being posted to the website on Tuesday, April 14, 2020. The survey is an opportunity for you provide input into the exterior design of the new facility. The survey will be available to all community members to complete from April 14, 2020 through April 21, 2020. The new school design process is on-going and on-track.
6. If you have questions, please contact me directly @ [email protected] or by phone 440.943.7736.
Thank you and I hope you had a nice holiday weekend.
Joe Spiccia

h3.span: Learning Materials, Opportunities, and Resources for April 6-May 1

span.div: The Wickliffe City School District is providing learning opportunities and resources as tools for our students and families during the extended school closure. These learning opportunities and resources are intended to promote learning and were designed by District staff to engage students during the extended closure. Please review the information below and on the Learning Materials, Opportunities, and Resources website carefully.

em.strong: The Wickliffe City School District administration, faculty, and staff understand that this is an unprecedented situation and that a lot is being asked of parents as well as school personnel. The District wants to provide as many learning opportunities for students as possible. The District respects and understands that we cannot replicate the face-to-face teaching and learning that typically takes place in our classrooms. We are asking students, parents, caregivers, teachers, and staff to do the best they can with the options and resources they have.

h3.span: Wickliffe Family Resource Center - Donations Needed

div.span: The Family Resource Center is in critical need of donations to meet the long term needs of families during this time. Please read for more information and a list of materials needed. Thank you for your support!
Please see the link below for second semester tutoring opportunities.

span.div: Wickliffe Elementary will host registration sessions for incoming Kindergarten students on Monday, June 1st from 8:00 AM-1:00 PM at Wickliffe Elementary. WES is located at 1821 Lincoln Road. For a registration packet and list of items and information to bring, please click on the "more" link at the end of this article.

h3.span: Camp Curiosity at the Great Lakes Science Center

span.span: for information about summer day camps at the Great Lakes Science Center.

div.span: Please review the attached for a tentative timeline for the new facilities project.

p.span: Quality Profile highlights some of the district’s story that goes beyond the traditionally reported and measured metrics.

Our goal in creating this Quality Profile is to provide all members of the community with a picture of what is happening in our schools and how we are defining our district’s success and the successes of our students. It is an opportunity for us to share with you about the high-quality educational programming we provide every day throughout the Wickliffe City School District.

We are grateful to the WCSD staff for all that they do to help our students Learn, Lead, and Serve. Further, we are grateful to all of our parents, caregivers, community members, and partners who work with us daily to ensure that the students of the district are cared for and are given opportunities to become future ready.

Each Child, Our Future - Ohio’s strategic plan for education - seeks to ensure each student is challenged, prepared, and empowered for his/her future by way of an excellent PK-12 education. Ohio’s schools can succeed by meeting the needs of the whole child- the physical, social, emotional, and intellectual aspects of a child’s well-being.

With House Bill 166, passed in July 2019, Ohio invested $675 million to help districts and schools support their students' academic achievement through mental health counseling, wraparound services, mentoring, and after school programs. School districts will work with local organizations to determine community needs, and then use the state dollars to make the greatest impact on students’ lives. It is estimated that over the next two years, the WCSD will receive over $290,000.00 to support our wellness programming for students. In Governor DeWine's letter to school leaders he specifically mentions the Wickliffe City Schools and their efforts through the Family Resource Center as a model of providing such services.

The Family Resource Center and our Student Ten Year Plan (career and workforce development) have both received recognition from the State for innovation and forward thinking. The district is a leader in creating and participating in internship programs, entrepreneurship efforts, career and workforce development and support services for students and families. We are proud to be part of a district and community that values its children and the entire community. The Wickliffe City School District: Inspiring Students to Learn, Lead, and Serve.
